work.name: IIT Gandhinagar
work.summary: Working on algorithms to improve efficiency of Spiking Neural Networks, testing different STDP approaches, and adaptive neurons under Prof. Sandip Lashkare.
highlights: Simulated SNNs using RRAM for pattern recognition
Implemented arbitrary STDP approach on MNIST dataset
Developed a standalone framework for SNN simulation from scratch. Available as a package "nervos".

publications.name: Asynchronous Real-Time Learning in Spiking Neural Network using 3-Terminal Resistance Random Access Memory
publications.summary: Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) mimic the human brain and are useful for tasks like pattern recognition with low energy use. Using RRAM crossbar arrays helps simulate synaptic weights and supports analog signal processing. However, standard two-terminal RRAMs struggle with simultaneous reading and writing, since reading uses low voltage and writing uses high voltage. To solve this, a 3-terminal Pr₀.₇Ca₀.₃MnO₃ (PCMO) RRAM is proposed. Two terminals are used for writing, and the third is used for reading, allowing real-time, asynchronous operation. This reduces circuit complexity and speeds up learning in SNNs.
